summary: This bill, the "Overcoming Prevalent Inadequacies in Overdose Information Data Sets Act" or the "OPIOIDS Act," aims to address the opioid crisis. It authorizes the Attorney General to award grants to states, territories, and localities to improve data collection and surveillance on opioid-related overdoses.  It also provides grants to law enforcement agencies for training, system upgrades in forensic labs, and training related to drug-related criminal activity. The bill mandates reporting to the National Forensic Laboratory Information System and calls for the DEA to develop uniform reporting standards and provides a funding line item for the Fentanyl Signature Profiling Program.
